intro: Clidemia scabrosa, commonly known as roughleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Clidemia scabrosa is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a potential invasive species in some regions.
